text:
Created attachment 34490
JSON Extractor screenshot

1. Add JSON Path Extractor to HTTP Request
2. Add two variable names
3. Add two JSON Path Expressions
4. Execute test.
5. Error throw is ERROR - jmeter.extractor.json.jsonpath.JSONPostProcessor: Number of JSON Path variables must match number of default values and json-path expressions, check you use separator ';' if you have many values

Workaround:  Add 2 Default Values and the JSON Path Extractor will work as expected.  By this I mean the extractor will get the correct variables and not use the default values.
creator: markpilon73@gmail.com
p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Hello,
I don't understand where the bug is here, as error message is clear.
Maybe the "bug" is that default values are mandatory and cannot be empty as entering ";" does not work.

Could you explain more "By this I mean the extractor will get the correct variables and not use the default values." ?

creator: markpilon73@gmail.com
text:
The error message is clear but it doesn't line up with the docs I was referencing here: http://jmeter.apache.org/usermanual/component_reference.html#JSON_Extractor

If I'm reading the docs correctly, the default values should not be required according to the Required column (though I see the Description column says it is.)

That said, that looks more like a small docs issue so I'll close this bug as invalid.
